meanings.definition: Extend or lie under something, especially in overlapping layers.
meanings.sent1: The blanket underlaps the mattress, keeping it warm.
meanings.sent2: The rug underlaps the edge of the table.
meanings.sent3: The cat loves to underlaps under the cozy blanket.
meanings.sent4: The roots of the tree underlaps the surface of the soil, anchoring it firmly.
meanings.sent5: The vines underlaps the fence, creating a natural barrier.

meanings.definition: The part of a garment that is turned under and sewn.
meanings.sent1: She carefully folded the underlaps of the dress before sewing.
meanings.sent2: The underlaps of the shirt were neatly finished.
meanings.sent3: The underlaps of the jacket peeked out from under the collar.
meanings.sent4: The underlaps of the skirt added a subtle detail to the design.
meanings.sent5: The underlaps of the pants were expertly tailored for a perfect fit.

meanings.definition: To extend or lie under something, especially in overlapping layers.
meanings.sent1: The roots of the plants underlaps in the rich soil.
meanings.sent2: The layers of paint underlaps on the canvas.
meanings.sent3: The river seems to underlaps under the bridge playfully.
meanings.sent4: The clouds underlaps in the sky, creating a beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent5: The pages of the book underlaps as the story unfolds.
